section: The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees at their discretion and convenience. The Customer acknowledges that failure to pay such fees in a timely manner will result in the interruption or discontinuation of services for the Hosted Site.
explanation: This statement is ambiguous because it says that The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees at their discretion and convenience. This suggests the customer can pay whenever they want and is not obligated to follow any set of payment deadlines.

section: This Agreement shall automatically be renewed for one (1) or more one (1) month periods unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the Agreement, which notice must be given not less than fifteen (15) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term. Either party may terminate this Agreement without cause at any time effective upon fifteen (15) days' written notice.
explanation: It is not clear if the 15 days mentioned is a period before the contract starts, or when the contract is active.

section: i-on's liability for damages to the Customer for any cause whatsoever, regardless of the form of action, and whether in contract or in tort, including negligence, shall be limited to one (1) month's fees and the remaining portion of any prepaid fees.
explanation: Negligence is not defined and is too broad, so it leads to multiple interpretations.  What constitutes negligence and how would it be determined.
